p: The flavonoid contents of the decocts and macerates of the four parts of the plant under study, obtained by the different solvents ( Table 3), show that maceration is preferable for extracting flavonoids in general from the leaves and flowers of Solanum and for Passiflora leaves, which recorded the highest level, with a mean of 736.10 Â± 5.38 mg eq Qu/100 g DM for MeOH NaF. On the other hand, decoction was in general the best method for an optimal flavonoid extraction from the flowers, stems and roots of Physalis and Passiflora.
